metadata.title: CVE-2023-5679 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A bad interaction between DNS64 and serve-stale may cause `named` to crashwith an assertion failure during recursive resolution, when both of thesefeatures are enabled. This issue affects BIND 9 versions 9.16.12 through9.16.45, 9.18.0 through 9.18.21, 9.19.0 through 9.19.19, 9.16.12-S1 through9.16.45-S1, and 9.18.11-S1 through 9.18.21-S1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16
bind9-dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16
bind9-host - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16
bind9-libs - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16
bind9-utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16
bind9utils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16
dnsutils - 1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.16.1-0ubuntu2.16').
